bug.summary: The conda installation still imposes a fixed version of tensorboard
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Not sure if this is done for a reason, but the conda installation of pytorch-lightning still requires tensorboard==2.2.0, evident from the recipe: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/conda-forge/pytorch-lightning-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml#L27>https://github.com/conda-forge/pytorch-lightning-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml#L27</denchmark-link>
Given that this issue has been fixed in v1.0.0, updating the conda feedstock would probably be a good idea. And it's not like I need the latest version of tensorboard. But just to have consistency across different installation methods.
